title: Schema for objects within x-bte-association-retrieval
description: Describes the operations that retrieve associations/edges between biomedical entities, using a knowledge-provider (KP) API in the Translator ecosystem.  A KP API may do multiple operations of this type. These operations are  defined (kept separate) by their different combinations of input-entity-type, biolink predicate, source, and output-entity-type.

queryInfo.description: Object that contains info on the query (API call) for this operation.  The OpenAPI /paths/operations may have specific fields  (like parameters, responseBody, etc.), and these can be set here.

inputs.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like). Describes the  valid inputs and their identifier namespaces for the query.

id.description: ID namespace prefix for the query input

semantic.description: Biolink entity class for the query input

requiresPrefix.description: Whether the API expects IDs to be curies (have prefixes included)  or not

outputs.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like). Describes the  valid outputs, their identifier namespaces, and the API JSON  response fields that contain them.

id.description: ID namespace prefix for the query output

semantic.description: Biolink entity class for the query output

responseField.description: Dot-notation for the field in API/JSON response that names/identifies the output biomedical entity in the association/relationship

containsPrefix.description: Whether the API responseField values are curies (have prefixes included)  or not

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

nodesConflated.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like). Used when  the associations conflate the Biolink entity classes/types  of the entities involved. For example, gene-disease associations often involve conflation of a gene with its altered gene product.

original.description: The current Biolink entity class (aka the node type) connected to this edge, which is being conflated with another Biolink entity class.

conflated.description: The Biolink entity class (aka the node type) that the association is rooted in from a biological point-of-view. For example, a gene-disease association may really be based on altered gene products and their activities; the original_type would be Gene and the conflated_type would be GeneProduct.

where.description: Name of the source (API/knowledge-source) where this happened, in  display format (source way of capitalizing their name, with spaces).   Should match the name of a knowledge-source described in the provenance  associationRetrieval field.

references.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.
Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

provenance.description: Groups together provenance related to this association.

oneOf.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like). Lists the sources and info about them (including how they create associations).

name.description: Name of the knowledge-source/API/resource. In display format (source way of  capitalizing their name, with spaces). Include words like API or RDF at the end of the name if those access methods were used.

sourceType.description: Type of knowledge-source/API/resource. Current possible values include service, knowledgebase, publications, text, clinical_database.

versionType.description: There are different formats / ways of specifying what the version is.  Current possible values include date_last_updated, version_number,  data_from_this_date, latest_date_covered.

method.description: Keyword noting what the knowledge-source/API/resource did to build the association from data/knowledge. Current possible values  include ingest, NLP, manual_curation, shared_phenotype, shared_disease,  shared_variant, submission, orthology_mapping.

sourceReferences.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.
Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

descriptiveInfo.description: Free-text description of what the source did to create the associations. Try to include enough detail that a reader would truly understand what happened.

sourceContext.description: Object (Python-dict-like). Keys specify the type of context. Values could  be static (not dependent on response), take on a specific value in the  API/JSON response, or tranformed from the value of a specific field in the  API/JSON response. Ideally, after processing, the final values will be  from ontologies (CURIE format) or will be short strings.  Context/relevance is information that restricts the use or  interpretation of this association.  This is sometimes necessary for querying or for knowing when the  retrieved association is relevant to the problem being addressed.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

numericMeasures.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like), gives info about  the measure and what response field to use to retrieve it.

name.description: Name of the measure (include the name of the resource that calculated it).  In display format (source way of capitalizing the names, with spaces).

ontologyTerm.description: Term from an ontology (ideally an OWL Class) that corresponds with this measure. Format is prefix:ID.

responseField.description: The measure value is in a specific field in the API response/JSON record.  Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.

missingValueMeaning.description: Short free-text, explaining what a missing/NULL/NA value for this  measure, for a specifc association/edge would mean. The assumption is  that only some associations/edges have a missing value.

measureReferences.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.
Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

range.description: Python-dict-like. Should define an expected lower and/or upper  bound for values (minimum and maximum). Inclusive means the range  includes the boundary number, exclusive means the range does not.  If the actual lower-bound of the value is negative-infinity and/or the actual upper bound of the value is positive-infinity, do not set a bound.

directionMeaning.description: Object (Python-dictionary-like). Each key specifies a direction  (larger, closer_to_zero, more_negative, etc.). Each value specifies what the direction means (more_specific, more_evidence,  more_confident, more_consistent, more_probable, etc.). One may want to  explain multiple directions (like when a value means something  different when closer to 0, closer to the upper bound, and closer to  the lower bound).

categoryMeasures.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like), gives info about  the measure and what response field to use to retrieve it.

name.description: Name of the measure (include the name of the resource that calculated it).  In display format (source way of capitalizing the names, with spaces).

ontologyTerm.description: Term from an ontology (ideally an OWL Class) that corresponds with this measure. Format is prefix:ID.

responseField.description: The measure value is in a specific field in the API response/JSON record.  Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.

missingValueMeaning.description: Short free-text, explaining what a missing/NULL/NA value for this  measure, for a specifc association/edge would mean. The assumption is  that only some associations/edges have a missing value.

measureReferences.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.
Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

categories.description: List the possible values for the category, ordered if there is an order to the values.

directionMeaning.description: Object (Python-dict-like). The key is the way to read the categories  array above, forward or reverse. The value is what the direction means  (more_specific, more_evidence, more_confident, more_consistent,  more_probable, etc.).

contextRelevance.description: Groups together context/relevance related to this specific association.  Context/relevance is information that restricts the use or  interpretation of this association.  This is sometimes necessary for querying or for knowing when the  retrieved association is relevant to the problem being addressed.

associationRetrieval.description: Object (Python-dict-like). Keys specify the type of context. Values could  be static (not dependent on response), take on a specific value in the  API/JSON response, or tranformed from the value of a specific field in the  API/JSON response. Ideally, after processing, the final values will be  from ontologies (CURIE format) or will be short strings.  Context/relevance is information that restricts the use or  interpretation of this association.  This is sometimes necessary for querying or for knowing when the  retrieved association is relevant to the problem being addressed.

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

descriptiveInfo.description: Free-text description of what the source did to create the associations. Try to include enough detail that a reader would truly understand what happened.

sourceContext.description: Object (Python-dict-like). Keys specify the type of context. Values could  be static (not dependent on response), take on a specific value in the  API/JSON response, or tranformed from the value of a specific field in the  API/JSON response. Ideally, after processing, the final values will be  from ontologies (CURIE format) or will be short strings.  Context/relevance is information that restricts the use or  interpretation of this association.  This is sometimes necessary for querying or for knowing when the  retrieved association is relevant to the problem being addressed.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

numericMeasures.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like), gives info about  the measure and what response field to use to retrieve it.

name.description: Name of the measure (include the name of the resource that calculated it).  In display format (source way of capitalizing the names, with spaces).

ontologyTerm.description: Term from an ontology (ideally an OWL Class) that corresponds with this measure. Format is prefix:ID.

responseField.description: The measure value is in a specific field in the API response/JSON record.  Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.

missingValueMeaning.description: Short free-text, explaining what a missing/NULL/NA value for this  measure, for a specifc association/edge would mean. The assumption is  that only some associations/edges have a missing value.

measureReferences.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.
Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

range.description: Python-dict-like. Should define an expected lower and/or upper  bound for values (minimum and maximum). Inclusive means the range  includes the boundary number, exclusive means the range does not.  If the actual lower-bound of the value is negative-infinity and/or the actual upper bound of the value is positive-infinity, do not set a bound.

directionMeaning.description: Object (Python-dictionary-like). Each key specifies a direction  (larger, closer_to_zero, more_negative, etc.). Each value specifies what the direction means (more_specific, more_evidence,  more_confident, more_consistent, more_probable, etc.). One may want to  explain multiple directions (like when a value means something  different when closer to 0, closer to the upper bound, and closer to  the lower bound).

categoryMeasures.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like), gives info about  the measure and what response field to use to retrieve it.

name.description: Name of the measure (include the name of the resource that calculated it).  In display format (source way of capitalizing the names, with spaces).

ontologyTerm.description: Term from an ontology (ideally an OWL Class) that corresponds with this measure. Format is prefix:ID.

responseField.description: The measure value is in a specific field in the API response/JSON record.  Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.

missingValueMeaning.description: Short free-text, explaining what a missing/NULL/NA value for this  measure, for a specifc association/edge would mean. The assumption is  that only some associations/edges have a missing value.

measureReferences.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.
Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

categories.description: List the possible values for the category, ordered if there is an order to the values.

directionMeaning.description: Object (Python-dict-like). The key is the way to read the categories  array above, forward or reverse. The value is what the direction means  (more_specific, more_evidence, more_confident, more_consistent,  more_probable, etc.).

contextRelevance.description: Groups together context/relevance related to this specific association.  Context/relevance is information that restricts the use or  interpretation of this association.  This is sometimes necessary for querying or for knowing when the  retrieved association is relevant to the problem being addressed.

associationRetrieval.description: Object (Python-dict-like). Keys specify the type of context. Values could  be static (not dependent on response), take on a specific value in the  API/JSON response, or tranformed from the value of a specific field in the  API/JSON response. Ideally, after processing, the final values will be  from ontologies (CURIE format) or will be short strings.  Context/relevance is information that restricts the use or  interpretation of this association.  This is sometimes necessary for querying or for knowing when the  retrieved association is relevant to the problem being addressed.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

id.description: ID namespace prefix for the query input

semantic.description: Biolink entity class for the query input

requiresPrefix.description: Whether the API expects IDs to be curies (have prefixes included)  or not

id.description: ID namespace prefix for the query output

semantic.description: Biolink entity class for the query output

responseField.description: Dot-notation for the field in API/JSON response that names/identifies the output biomedical entity in the association/relationship

containsPrefix.description: Whether the API responseField values are curies (have prefixes included)  or not

staticValue.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

takesOnResponseValue.description: Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.

transformedFromResponseValue.description: Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

transformUsingTemplate.description: Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

original.description: The current Biolink entity class (aka the node type) connected to this edge, which is being conflated with another Biolink entity class.

conflated.description: The Biolink entity class (aka the node type) that the association is rooted in from a biological point-of-view. For example, a gene-disease association may really be based on altered gene products and their activities; the original_type would be Gene and the conflated_type would be GeneProduct.

where.description: Name of the source (API/knowledge-source) where this happened, in  display format (source way of capitalizing their name, with spaces).   Should match the name of a knowledge-source described in the provenance  associationRetrieval field.

referenceObj.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

oneProvenanceList.description: Array of objects (Python-list-of-dict-like). Lists the sources and info about them (including how they create associations).

name.description: Name of the knowledge-source/API/resource. In display format (source way of  capitalizing their name, with spaces). Include words like API or RDF at the end of the name if those access methods were used.

sourceType.description: Type of knowledge-source/API/resource. Current possible values include service, knowledgebase, publications, text, clinical_database.

versionType.description: There are different formats / ways of specifying what the version is.  Current possible values include date_last_updated, version_number,  data_from_this_date, latest_date_covered.

method.description: Keyword noting what the knowledge-source/API/resource did to build the association from data/knowledge. Current possible values  include ingest, NLP, manual_curation, shared_phenotype, shared_disease,  shared_variant, submission, orthology_mapping.

sourceReferences.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

name.description: Name of the knowledge-source/API/resource. In display format (source way of  capitalizing their name, with spaces). Include words like API or RDF at the end of the name if those access methods were used.

sourceType.description: Type of knowledge-source/API/resource. Current possible values include service, knowledgebase, publications, text, clinical_database.

versionType.description: There are different formats / ways of specifying what the version is.  Current possible values include date_last_updated, version_number,  data_from_this_date, latest_date_covered.

method.description: Keyword noting what the knowledge-source/API/resource did to build the association from data/knowledge. Current possible values  include ingest, NLP, manual_curation, shared_phenotype, shared_disease,  shared_variant, submission, orthology_mapping.

sourceReferences.description: Used to provide publications and website URLs for users who want to learn  more about an association, knowledge-source, measure, context/relevance, etc.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.
Edge property is dynamic but has to be transformed from other values (API response/JSON record fields or variables) using a template

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the  template and data (denoted using keywords). Also describes the result  (what is the edge property key, what is the value).

template.description: the string template (Python string-formatting-like). Keywords inside  curly brackets denote the parts of the template that should be  replaced by the corresponding values (see templateKeys).

templateKeys.description: Python-dict-like. Keys are the keywords used in the template; values are the API/JSON response fields or variable names that contain data. The data should be used to replace the keywords in the template.

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  to get the desired info (edge property with value being an array of strings).

descriptiveInfo.description: Free-text description of what the source did to create the associations. Try to include enough detail that a reader would truly understand what happened.

sourceContext.description: Object (Python-dict-like). Keys specify the type of context. Values could  be static (not dependent on response), take on a specific value in the  API/JSON response, or tranformed from the value of a specific field in the  API/JSON response. Ideally, after processing, the final values will be  from ontologies (CURIE format) or will be short strings.  Context/relevance is information that restricts the use or  interpretation of this association.  This is sometimes necessary for querying or for knowing when the  retrieved association is relevant to the problem being addressed.

oneOf.description: Edge property is static, not dependent on response values. In this  situation, a field called value is used.

Edge property is dynamic and should have the value of a specific field in  the API response/JSON record. In this situation, a field called  responseField is used. Use dot-notation to refer to the response field.
Edge property is dynamic but its value has to be mapped or transformed  from the value of a specific field in the API response/JSON record.

instructions.description: describes what should be done to get the desired info, using the other items in this object. Also describes the result (what is the edge  property key, what is the value).

responseField.description: dot-notation for field in API/JSON response to use.

mappingFile.description: github link to YAML file that contains the mapping from values in  specific API/JSON responses to the desired info. Used for  post-processing (see bteCode field).

bteCode.description: github link to code that BTE uses to post-process API/JSON response  (either using the mapping file or calling services) and get the info.
